p: The symptoms of hepatitis include fever, abdominal pain, anorexia, nausea, and vomiting. There is a period of cholestasis where the stools are clay colored and the urine is dark. Pruritus and a transient macular rash may be seen. Physical exam demonstrates jaundice and an enlarged tender liver. Serum transaminases are elevated and there is a conjugated hyperbilirubinemia. Ultrasound demonstrates a mildly enlarged liver.
